network

Class Node<T extends Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Node<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of message this type of node receives.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeferredSchedulingNode

    public abstract class Node<T extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that provides the basic functionality of a network node.

    Hides away concurrency details and other ordering issues. Users of this class must provide:

    • Update on a global clock: onUpdate(int)
    • Receive messages destined for this node: onReceiveMessage(int, Message)
    • Route messages through this node: scheduleMessage(int, Node, Message), sendOutboundMessages(int)
    Author:
    Bitidork

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(int time)
        Updates this node at the supplied time.

        The general structure of this method is as follows:

        1. Process incoming messages (processMessage(int, Node, Message))
          1. Process messages destined for this node (onReceiveMessage(int, Message))
          2. Schedule messages going through this node (scheduleMessage(int, Node, Message))
        2. User-defined update event (onUpdate(int))
        3. Send some scheduled messages (sendOutboundMessages(int))
        Parameters:
        time - The time the update is being performed.

      • processMessage

        public void processMessage(int time,
                  Node<T> source,
                  T message)
        Processes a message that is going over the link between source and this node.

        Messages destined for this node will go through onReceiveMessage(int, Message). Messages destined for another node will go through scheduleMessage(int, Node, Message).

        Parameters:
        time - The time the message was received.
        message - The message to process.

      • addLink

        public void addLink(int time,
           InputLink<T> link)
        Registers the supplied link as an input link to this node. The link must be used exclusively by methods provided by the Node class.
        Parameters:
        time - The time at which the link is registered.
        link - The link to register with this node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this node is not the sink of the link
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the link is busy (cannot transmit)

      • addLink

        public void addLink(int time,
           OutputLink<T> link)
        Registers the supplied link as an output link from this node. The link must be used exclusively by methods provided by the Node class.
        Parameters:
        time - The time at which the link is registered.
        link - The link to register with this node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this node is not the source of the link
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the link is busy (cannot transmit)

      • getOutputLinks

        public java.util.Collection<OutputLink<T>> getOutputLinks()
        Gets the set of output links from this node.
        Returns:
        Returns an unmodifiable set of output links from this node.

      • transmitToNode

        public void transmitToNode(int time,
                  Node<T> sink,
                  T message)
        Transmits message to the supplied sink starting at time. Takes care of internal book-keeping.
        Parameters:
        time - The time to start transmitting the message.
        sink - The node to transmit to.
        message - The message to transmit.
